This is the perfect thread to stress test this place. Have at it.

posts.body:
>>4bf26383-3bfb-4d03-bc61-9711595a1b57
I can't even look at pictures via TOR.
Without TOR, loading threads and thumbnails is already faster than 8chan. If videos load satisfiably fast then we're looking at a system that I would define as an upgrade over 8chan.
I'm happy in a way I have never been before.

>>e4d4f1e5-e365-4a94-a524-14cb059e4618
I'm imagining private tracker economics here.
You don't actually need to always seed to 1.0 ratio to keep things alive. There's always enough charitable users that on average speeds are satisfying even if most users aren't seeding very well. Of course, let's not encourage leeching, but if people do what they can, I think this can be comfortably pulled off. 
We just need to promote the mindset that if you like the place then you should host it aswell.
>>423e0bf5-9bd6-436b-9680-1c99e6c2c959
Not him, but definitely TOR enforced.
I have working TOR and connect to TOR users, but it's not enforced, and everything works fine. If I force it always on, then the website is unbearably slow.
>>b7211ef6-5cc2-478c-bbe5-a99a84c42eda
If your VPN is safe, then it's safe. The objective here is to be anonymous by hiding your IP so that glowniggers can't come after it.
TOR itself is not safe, but it's better than nothing I'd wager.
>>f41da36e-2cec-4c86-b2da-4e4d279b1478
Yes, it is. TOR is partially broken, and because p2p looks like spam to them, your individual connection gets banned, and it keeps repeating over and over, slowing down zeronet for you. I bet you're even failing to connect to most trackers, I have that issue on TOR always too.

I have a partial fix for certs. I saw it on /pol/ I think. It will generate a new cert every time zero net starts up, it keeps blacklists and the like.
There's a zeronet plugin that generates a new cert every time zeronet is started. It's included by default, but disabled.
You can enable it by going to your zeronet folder and renaming its folder from "disabled-Multiuser" to "Multiuser".
I'm on Linux, for me, I had to go to /usr/share/zeronet/plugins/ to find that folder.

It's not perfect, but if you turn off the computer when you go to bed, you at least get a cert a day automatically.

>>1753f5c5-174d-4400-a9f9-bfe61924f5c4
/tech/ anon has it summed up.

>>4a54de7e-e5e0-4c1c-b238-8d75efb9bd42
Mine appeared to be stuck until I clicked on another tab and then back and it completed instantly.

>>ca1da306-4129-4853-9e9e-9bc5b3a86249
I have tor as a daemon and don't use the browser, I still get white thumbnail.

>>9ac7162a-f305-490a-a5f5-4ff6d58b1bd4
We may be down, but our cocks remain in high spirits, and also angles.

>>8883fc6b-6b3e-4569-a0f0-9a069eb30009
I have tor only for tor peers, my port is open, and I only get 1000 peers.
On the 6th I saw 6000 peers.
Regardless, we are now technonazis living in the cyberpunk era with all the good and bad that comes from it. Rejoice.

>>cf7a7e7f-771d-4819-b30c-de7d002334c4
Smugloli has the most users I'm afraid, they are the ones with the only working clearnet website, and the large amount of users unwilling to try a zeronet-like solution has made all those people go there.
They're really asshurt for that because /a/ is very hostile to every other board on 8chan, so that much is nice.
Post VR WEBMs

>>884976a0-a01c-4cce-a1ca-ba7c9ccd6b6a

I am not pleased.

>>1d855ab6-1806-4357-a6d1-d0e5c31b9b04
>niggerpill's first cert has  "Gay" written in it
Never forget.
I have a complete board backup of polarchive dating 2019-03-16. Are you guys interested in it?
>The conversation almost immediately turned to users calling each other racist slurs and debating whether sexualized cartoons of children were pedophilic.

>>daec1692-9508-423d-a709-22674652db2c
They can be as big as you want, but people automatically seeding have specified file size limits, and at the very least you have to seed it to completion at least once assuming the other seeder will seed forever which is not necessarily the case.
That means the only filesize limit is "keep it down"
To the people having issues with files being unpinned, make sure you use the Multiuser plugin to change certs and that you have spare storage for the website.

>>7fc21bcb-091f-4993-b8eb-7ae9f9e60e41
I think this is pretty good.
Make the content of the blacklists easily visible and make people able to look at the blacklisted posts if they're still seeded, so that people can moderate the moderator and warn each other if the moderator has gone rogue.
I think then moderators with clearly defined goals that people can opt into will naturally flourish.
